page.title: 12 College Scouts,Oxford
page.content: The college servants or "scouts", begin work at 8.30. They "clock in" and collect their cleaning equipment from personal lockers. Each scout has ten rooms to clean every day from Monday to Friday. During term time the rooms belong to the students and the scout's job is to tidy up generally. They make beds and do the washing up. In vacation time the college has different conferences and the scout's work is like a chambermaid's. All the students in Somerville College are girls, some have strange habits, leaving washing up for weeks on end and shoving rubbish under beds. Some are in the college rowing club and get up at 5 a.m.to row. Scouts often find them back in bed at 10! Things like this make a scout's work more interesting. Their daily work finishes at 12.30.
